title: Store tells me I don't have enough IP when client says I do
body: I had an issue recently when I went to get a rune I needed that cost 2050 IP. My IP balance in the top right showed 2156 but the store said "Not enough IP". Later when I relog, my IP balance drops to 2026- but I certainly didn't ever spend 120 IP. What gives here?

replies.body:
Looking into this, I see that your IP is actually at 2195, Aurelion Sol being your most recent purchase.  This may be a balance sync issue on the updated client.  Switching back to the legacy then hopping back to the updated version should update things.

-  On the login screen of the open beta updated client, look for the "Launch Legacy Client" text at the bottom.
-  Or create a shortcut directly to the legacy client in your League Installation. Just look for "lol.launcher"

Let me know if that clears things up!

Yep, I actually had played another game since then though. I'm still confused at how the client could think my IP was higher than it was unless I just bought something and it didn't update correctly. 

this got things back in sync I guess, though it was still annoying to end up waiting one more game to get that speed quent Asol needs :P

This seems a lot like those signs at the gas pumps "in case of a disagreement between this register and the one inside, this register shall be considered the correct one."
